title: [$125] [Translation Migration] Fix split or incomplete translations in scheduledCall

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Problem This batch contains incomplete translations that need to be migrated to use translation parameters instead of split keys or trailing spaces. ## Translation Keys to Fix - `scheduledCall.book.slots` - Current value: `"Available times for "` ## Example PRs See these PRs for examples of how to perform this migration: - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/54544 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/54545 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70523 More examples can be found in the tracking issue: https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/62808 ## Migration Steps 1. Identify where these translation keys are used in the codebase 2. Combine split translations (keys containing "part") into single translation strings with parameters 3. Remove trailing spaces from translation values and combine them properly with whatever rich text content is displayed after them in the app 4. Update the code to pass the appropriate parameters to the translation function, usually wrapping rich text with react-native-render-html as seen in the example PRs 5. Test the changes to ensure the translations render correctly

https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/54544 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/54545 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70523 More examples can be found in the tracking issue: https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/62808 ## Migration Steps 1. Identify where these translation keys are used in the codebase 2. Combine split translations (keys containing "part") into single translation strings with parameters 3. Remove trailing spaces from translation values and combine them properly with whatever rich text content is displayed after them in the app 4. Update the code to pass the appropriate parameters to the translation function, usually wrapping rich text with react-native-render-html as seen in the example PRs 5. Test the changes to ensure the translations render correctly

title: [CFI] Reduce the PDF download steps by one click.

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.2.22-6
**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** None
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Issue reported by:** @jamesdeanexpensify 
**Slack conversation:** [#product](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1759856167956489) 

## Action Performed:
1. Create a report
2. Add a couple of expenses to it 
3. Click More > `Download as PDF`
4. Click `Download`

## Expected Result:
_This is an improvement after a complaint was brought to us by a customer._

- We want to action on generating and downloading the PDF when `Download as PDF` is clicked in step 3, instead of having to force clicking "download" again when ready. 
- As for the alert modal, we can change that button from `Download` to `Got it` to dismiss it. 

## Actual Result:
You have to click `Download` again in the alert modal, which forces an extra click unnecessarily. 

## Workaround:
Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari
- [ ] MacOS: Desktop

<details>
  <summary>Platforms Tested:</summary>
On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested:

- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari
- [ ] MacOS: Desktop

</details>

## Screenshots/Videos

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1160/folder/13176910/41237479/936933725 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1896@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb) **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Navigate to workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Long tap on the expense preview and hold the expense. 5. Long tap on preview again, and remove hold from expense. 6. Open the report. 7. Note that "New Messages" badge appears briefly on top of report. 8. Scroll to the bottom of the report and return to the top. 9. Note that now, badge remains displayed. ## Expected Result: "New Messages" badge on transaction thread, should remain displayed when the new messages are not visible. ## Actual Result: "New Messages" badge on transaction thread, only appears briefly when there are new system messages on report. Badge only remain displayed after scrolling to the bottom of report and returning to the top. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/66e94b36-e54f-4977-80a3-2aaba189b01d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
